title: Family of man fatally shot by Walgreens security guard files $25M wrongful death suit
description: The family of a man fatally shot by a security guard in a San Francisco Walgreens last month during an apparent shoplifting altercation has filed a $25 million lawsuit.

title: Treasury sets new potential debt default deadline of June 5
description: The update buys much-needed time for debt ceiling negotiators to hammer out a deal

title: Player faints during LSU Tigers’ national title celebration at the White House
description: A scary moment occurred when LSU's Sa'maya Smith fainted during the event.

title: New York City mayor signs ban on weight and height discrimination
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams has signed legislation that will ban discrimination based on body size by adding weight and height to the list of protected categories such as race, sex and religion

title: WATCH:  California police officer rescues runaway horse
description: A police officer in Burbank, California, utilized his horseback riding skills while on duty when rescuing a runaway horse.

title: Parents described as 'monsters' in horrific abuse that killed 10-month-old in England
description: Two English parents convicted of murder in the horrific abuse of their 10-month-old son who died on Christmas Day have been sentenced to life in prison

title: WATCH:  Kid comforts dog after bath
description: This parent captured footage of their child holding and comforting their Italian greyhound with sweet words after its bath.

title: Stepfather of murdered Delaware 3-year-old pleads guilty to child endangerment
description: The stepfather of a 3-year-old girl whose burned remains were found on a softball field several years ago has pleaded guilty to child endangerment charges

title: Texas grand jury indicts man in fatal shooting of rapper Takeoff
description: Court records say a man has been indicted on a murder charge in the shooting of Migos rapper Takeoff last year outside a Houston bowling alley

title: Negotiators have 'made progress' but no debt limit deal as deadline nears: McCarthy
description: With potential default just six days away, House Speaker Kevin McCarthy arrived at the Capitol Friday telling reporters he remained optimistic a deal could be reached.

title: Former Oath Keeper sentenced for role in Jan. 6 Capitol attack
description: Jessica Watkins was given more than eight years in prison.

title: Crash of private Japanese moon lander blamed on software, last-minute location switch
description: A Tokyo company whose lunar lander slammed into the moon says a software issue and a last-minute switch in the touchdown location led to the crash

title: Baseball player fatally struck in the face while dismantling unapproved dugout
description: A coroner in Pennsylvania ruled that a college baseball player died accidentally when a makeshift dugout collapsed and he was struck in the face

title: Prosecutor: Trio convicted of murder in fatal shooting of former Indiana U football player
description: Three people have been convicted in the fatal shooting of a former Indiana University football player who was gunned down during unrest in Indianapolis following the death of George Floyd

title: A measure of inflation that is closely tracked by the Federal Reserve increased in April
description: A key index of U.S. prices ticked higher in April, and consumer spending rebounded, a sign that inflationary pressures in the economy remain high

title: Bank customer stops robbery with a hug
description: Michael Armus Sr. was depositing a check at Bank of the West, near Sacramento, California, on Monday morning.

title: Inside the crisis of the crumbling federal prison system
description: All of the nation's 123 prisons in disrepair: Inspector General

title: Experts see 'slippery slope' if parents prevail in Nashville school shooting case
description: A judge's ruling allowing parents to have a say in the release of police evidence in a Nashville school mass shooting could lead to a "slippery slope," experts said.

title: Chicago woman beaten while struggling with gunman who stole her French bulldog
description: A 64-year-old Chicago woman says she was beaten and her French bulldog was stolen at gunpoint as she was taking it for a walk in her northwest side neighborhood

title: Bear who killed runner in Italy's Alps is spared death for now by court
description: An administrative court in Italy's Alpine region has for now spared the life of the bear who fatally attacked a runner last month

title: Strong earthquake shakes eastern Japan; no tsunami warning
description: A strong earthquake has shaken Tokyo and other areas of eastern Japan, but no tsunami warning was issued

title: British Cycling publishes new transgender policy with 'open' and 'female' categories
description: Riders who were born male will be prevented from racing in British Cycling’s elite female events under a new transgender and non-binary participation policy published by the governing body

title: Court says Hugh Grant's lawsuit alleging illegal snooping by tabloid can go to trial
description: A London court has rejected an attempt by the publisher of The Sun newspaper to throw out a lawsuit by actor Hugh Grant alleging that journalists and investigators it hired illegally snooped on him

title: Police in Florida say they fatally shot armed woman who 'ambushed' them in park
description: Authorities say police in a Florida park fatally shot an armed woman who “ambushed” them as they were searching for a drug investigation suspect

title: WATCH:  Plane lands safely after passenger opens exit door during flight
description: A passenger opened an emergency exit door during a plane flight in South Korea, causing air to blast inside the cabin and slightly injure 12 people, officials say.

title: Indiana reprimands doctor for talking publicly about Ohio 10-year-old's abortion
description: The Indiana Medical Licensing Board decided late Thursday to reprimand and fine a doctor who provided an abortion to a 10-year-old rape victim from neighboring Ohio.

title: South Korean passenger plane flies with open door, lands safely
description: Asiana Airlines and government officials say a passenger opened an emergency exit door during a flight in South Korea

title: Man joins VIP convoy, hugs German chancellor; security breach under investigation
description: German police have been left red-faced after a member of the public was able to slip into a VIP convoy for Chancellor Olaf Scholz and then give him a hearty hug as he prepared to board a plane at Frankfurt Airport

title: Asked about pardoning Trump as president, DeSantis says he would be 'aggressive'
description: Ron DeSantis on Thursday suggested he might use his pardon power as president to offer clemency to Jan. 6 defendants or even Trump

title: Ford electric vehicle owners to get access to Tesla Supercharger network starting next spring
description: All of Ford‘s current and future electric vehicles will have access to about 12,000 Tesla Supercharger stations in the U.S. and Canada starting next spring

title: Jury selection wraps in Pittsburgh synagogue massacre with testimony expected Tuesday
description: Jury selection has concluded in the trial of a man charged with killing 11 worshippers at a Pittsburgh synagogue in the deadliest antisemitic attack in U.S. history

title: NTSB: Unsafe speeds blamed for fiery crash that killed 10
description: Federal traffic investigators report that unsafe driving speeds of multiple vehicles, combined with wet road conditions and low visibility, was the probable cause of a fiery 2021 interstate crash in Alabama that killed nine children and one adult

title: Adnan Syed's murder conviction on hold for now, as Maryland Supreme Court considers appeal
description: Maryland’s highest court has issued an order to prevent Adnan Syed's murder conviction from being reinstated by a lower court, as the court decides whether to hear his appeal of the lower court’s decision

title: Oklahoma Legislature overrides governor's veto of tribal regalia bill
description: The Oklahoma Legislature has overridden Gov. Kevin Stitt's veto of a bill that would allow students to wear Native American regalia during high school and college graduations
